trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref> Web server control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the action list collection for this designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> object, adds the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object obtained from the base property, and then returns this collection.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner"></xref> control allows resizing.
`true` if the control allows resizing; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the collection of automatic format schemes that will be displayed in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

The elements of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> class and are populated from internally defined XML-encoded constant strings.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref>.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets the mode of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control, which can be a copy, to the current mode of the actual control.
Next, it forces the child controls to be recreated, and then calls the base method to generate the markup.

If an error occurs, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup for a placeholder.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%28System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection%29> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.
It also adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object to the `regions` parameter that describes the current view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which a definition of the current view of the associated control has been added.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref> at design time.
Gets the persisted form of the current template of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method serializes the current template (the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangePasswordTemplate%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.SuccessTemplate%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control to its persisted form, which is a <xref:System.String> object of markup text.
This persisted form consists of the serialized child controls appended together.

An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> that is not used by this <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion)"></xref> override.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the persisted form of the current template of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref>.
Gets the markup that renders to a placeholder containing information about the error that occurred while attempting to create or render the associated control at design time.
The placeholder contains the type and control names, an error message, and the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property that is associated with the `e` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that was thrown while creating or rendering the associated control.
The markup for the placeholder that contains information about the specified exception.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the control specified by `component`.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref>, which implements <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute to `false` for properties that do not apply to templates (removes them from the **Properties** grid) when a user template has been defined.
A collection implementing the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the added and shadowed properties.
Specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner"></xref> control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner> control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup.
You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to true.
Removing the outer table gives you greater flexibility in how you apply CSS rules to the markup that is rendered by the control.
`true` if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Sets the value of a template of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets an editable region in a designer to a control or template that is specified in its persisted form by the `content` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> to set content for.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing a persisted control or template.
Gets a collection of template groups for the templates of the control that is associated with this designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property constructs a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection> object and populates it with the collection returned by the base property.

It then adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> object for each of the templates (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangePasswordTemplate%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.SuccessTemplate%2A>) of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each template in the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ChangePasswordDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property were overridden to return `false`, the designer would use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword> itself to generate the design-time markup.
Always `true`.
